title: Land Securities builds £650m war chest with property sell-off including Brighton Marina
text:
Land Securities is on the cusp of signing a deal to sell a portfolio of properties worth £650million.

The company’s move comes as it is believed to be gathering funds for a fresh assault on London’s property market.

Assets on the block include Brighton Marina and bars and restaurants next to Oxford Castle.

Assets on the block include Brighton Marina and bars and restaurants next to Oxford Castle

They are currently held through X-Leisure, in which Land Sec has a 95 per cent stake. Land Sec has agreed to sell that stake to London-based private equity buyer CIT, according to The Sunday Times.

The firm is instead set to refocus its attentions on the London office space market. Almost half of its portfolio is made up of offices in the capital, with their rents expected to soon reach £140million.

Its fresh focus on London comes as Wework, the American start-up that offers temporary office space and has been expanding rapidly in the City, has been laid low by doubts about its profitability and a disastrous attempt to float on the New York stock market.

Wework cancelled its float last month after a string of controversies surrounding boss Adam Neumann, who was ousted as chief executive over the debacle.

Land Sec declined to comment.
description: Land Securities' move comes as it is believed to be gathering funds for a fresh assault on London's property market.
authors: Finance Reporter For The Daily Mail
